rules.natural: If a person uses a drug, then that drug is approved.
Either a person violates a protocol, or if a regulator investigates a drug, then the regulator does not reject that drug.
Under the condition that a person notifies a regulator, the material is destroyed.
Provided that a person reports an incident, then either a drug is recalled, or if it is not the case that a defective material implies a quality failure, then the material is not hazardous.
If a person is responsible for a process, then the person must either notify a regulator or report an incident.
Whenever a person produces a material, the person uses a drug.
If a regulator suspends production, then provided that a drug is not approved, the drug is not safe.
Under the condition that a regulator halts production, then if a drug is not approved, the drug is not safe.
Provided that a regulator conducts an audit, the regulator completes an investigation.
A regulator conducts an audit, or a regulator issues a warning.
Whenever a regulator issues a warning, the regulator halts production.
If a regulator completes an investigation, then the regulator suspends production.
If a researcher develops a formula, then the researcher publishes results.
Provided that a researcher patents a formula, then if it is not the case that synthesizing a drug implies either testing the drug or producing a material, the drug is not effective.
If a researcher publishes results, then the researcher patents a formula.
A material is imported from a country, or a regulator approves a drug.
Under the condition that a regulator bans an import, the material is not imported from a country.

Provided that a regulator inspects a facility, then either the facility quarantines a material, or a drug is recalled, or if it is not the case that a defective material implies a quality failure, then the material is not hazardous.
A regulator inspects a facility, or a regulator monitors a process.
Under the condition that an agency certifies a facility, the facility is accredited.

An agency certifies a facility, or if a regulator monitors a process, then either a facility quarantines a material, or a drug is recalled, or if it is not the case that a defective material implies a quality failure, then the material is not hazardous.
Provided that a facility is accredited, the facility is compliant.
If a facility is accredited, then the facility is not compliant.
If a technician detects contamination, then if the material is toxic, the drug is not safe.
A technician detects contamination, or a technician identifies a defect.
If a person analyzes a material, then the person either tests a drug or produces a material.
A person analyzes a material, or a person synthesizes a drug.
Under the condition that a technician identifies a defect, then if the material is toxic, the drug is not safe.
If a person synthesizes a drug, then the person purifies the drug.
Provided that a person purifies a drug, the person either tests the drug or produces a material.
If a regulator approves a drug, then if the drug is not approved, the material does not contaminate the drug.
If it is not the case that a defective material implies a quality failure, then the material is hazardous.
If it is not the case that synthesizing a drug implies either testing the drug or producing a material, then the drug is effective.
Whenever a regulator does not approve a drug, the regulator investigates the drug.
If a regulator does not approve a drug, then the regulator rejects the drug.
If a drug is not approved, then the material is defective.
Provided that a drug is not approved, the drug is safe.
If a drug is not approved, then the material is toxic.
Under the condition that a drug is not approved, the material contaminates the drug.

(A1 → G).natural: If a person uses a drug, then that drug is approved.

(A10 → ¬A9).natural: Provided that a regulator investigates a drug, the regulator does not reject the drug.

(A11 ∨ (A10 → ¬A9)).natural: Either a person violates a protocol, or if a regulator investigates a drug, then the regulator does not reject that drug.

(A13 → A12).natural: Provided that a material is defective, it fails quality standards.

(A15 ∨ (¬(A13 → A12) → ¬A14)).natural: Either a drug is recalled, or if it is not the case that a defective material implies a quality failure, then the material is not hazardous.

(A16 ∨ (A15 ∨ (¬(A13 → A12) → ¬A14))).natural: A material is destroyed, or a drug is recalled, or if it is not the case that a defective material implies a quality failure, then the material is not hazardous.

(A17 → A16).natural: Under the condition that a person notifies a regulator, the material is destroyed.

(A17 ∨ A18).natural: A person notifies a regulator, or a person reports an incident.

(A18 → (A15 ∨ (¬(A13 → A12) → ¬A14))).natural: Provided that a person reports an incident, then either a drug is recalled, or if it is not the case that a defective material implies a quality failure, then the material is not hazardous.

(A19 → (A17 ∨ A18)).natural: If a person is responsible for a process, then the person must either notify a regulator or report an incident.

(A2 → A1).natural: Whenever a person produces a material, the person uses a drug.

(A21 → (¬G → ¬A20)).natural: If a regulator suspends production, then provided that a drug is not approved, the drug is not safe.

(A21 ∨ A22).natural: A regulator suspends production, or a regulator halts production.

(A22 → (¬G → ¬A20)).natural: Under the condition that a regulator halts production, then if a drug is not approved, the drug is not safe.

(A23 → A21).natural: If a regulator conducts an audit, then the regulator suspends production.

(A23 → A25).natural: Provided that a regulator conducts an audit, the regulator completes an investigation.

(A24 → A22).natural: Whenever a regulator issues a warning, the regulator halts production.

(A25 → A21).natural: If a regulator completes an investigation, then the regulator suspends production.

(A27 → (¬(A5 → (A3 ∨ A2)) → ¬A26)).natural: If a researcher develops a formula, then if it is not the case that synthesizing a drug implies either testing the drug or producing a material, the drug is not effective.

(A27 → A28).natural: Provided that a researcher develops a formula, the researcher patents the formula.

(A27 → A29).natural: If a researcher develops a formula, then the researcher publishes results.

(A28 → (¬(A5 → (A3 ∨ A2)) → ¬A26)).natural: Provided that a researcher patents a formula, then if it is not the case that synthesizing a drug implies either testing the drug or producing a material, the drug is not effective.

(A29 → A28).natural: If a researcher publishes results, then the researcher patents a formula.

(A3 ∨ A2).natural: A person tests a drug, or a person produces a material.

(A31 → ¬A30).natural: Under the condition that a regulator bans an import, the material is not imported from a country.

(A32 ∨ (A15 ∨ (¬(A13 → A12) → ¬A14))).natural: A facility quarantines a material, or a drug is recalled, or if it is not the case that a defective material implies a quality failure, then the material is not hazardous.
